sub_topic: Determining the volume of a sphere.
message_1: What is the volume of a sphere with a radius of 5 cm?
message_2:
The volume V of a sphere can be calculated using the formula:

V = (4/3)πr³

where r is the radius of the sphere. In this case, the radius is 5 cm.

V = (4/3)π(5 cm)³
V = (4/3)π(125 cm³)
V ≈ 4.19 * 125 cm³
V ≈ 523.6 cm³

The volume of the sphere with a radius of 5 cm is approximately 523.6 cubic centimeters.
